text: <@U3T21PDBK> A new design language refers to the overarching scheme or style for the UI. For example, how our new page layout looks, our new card-based UI for API schema, and colors and fonts.

<@U3T21PDBK>, is there something specific style-wise you think we're missing? The styling is nearly identical except for the width and background, but those are intentional differences. But perhaps we missed something else?
And heard on the dark mode :+1:

“To retrieve the `associationTypeId` value, refer to <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/crm/associations/association-details#association-type-id-values|this list> of default values,” on <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/crm/objects/deals>

“this list” 404s
so does the “associations API” link below it

The new site looks really nice, but to be honest, it’s a bummer that I’m hitting multiple 404s in the first 10 minutes trying to use it. I don’t really have time to be switching between versions to find missing links <@U03PJER6S8P>
<@U037ZPYEGAF> apologies! Some content has been moved around a bit, and we're working to get everything sorted.

topic:
We welcome any and all feedback for our Dev Docs beta. Remember, as a beta, these resources are subject to change and ongoing updates.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/>
